Kentucky Derby julep: A peach of a local libation Skip to content All Sections Subscribe Now 79¬∞F Wednesday, September 10th 2025 Daily e-Edition Evening e-Edition Home Page Daily e-Edition Evening e-Edition News News Latest Headlines Politics Education National News Local News Local News Lake County Orange County Osceola County Seminole County Health Health Medicare Sports Sports High School Sports UCF Knights Orlando Magic Mike Bianchi Commentary Florida Gators Business Business Tourism Economy Real Estate GrowthSpotter Consumer Reviews Weather Weather Conditions and Forecasts Hurricanes Hurricane preparedness Hurricane Tracks Opinion Opinion Letters to the Editor Scott Maxwell Commentary Editorials Endorsements Entertainment Entertainment Theater and Arts Things to Do Horoscopes Restaurants, Food & Drink Events Travel Travel Theme Parks Epic Universe Explore Florida Cruises Florida & Caribbean Experiences Obituaries Obituaries News Obituaries Place an Obituary Branded Content Paid Partner Content Advertising by Ascend Paid Content by Brandpoint Classifieds Services About the Orlando Sentinel Manage Subscription Subscriber Benefits Sign up for Newsletters Buy an advertisement Sign up for email newsletters Sign Up Restaurants, Food & Drink | Forward/Slash Distillery‚Äôs Kentucky Derby‚Ä¶ Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Subscribe Login Account Settings Contact Us Log Out Spoof a user Sign up for email newsletters Sign Up Subscribe Login Search 79¬∞F Wednesday, September 10th 2025 Daily e-Edition Evening e-Edition Sponsored by Entertainment Theater and Arts Things to Do Horoscopes Restaurants, Food & Drink Travel Trending: ‚òπÔ∏è Ticked off! üöÄ Launch schedule üîç Restaurant Inspections üè† Homeless Camping Ban üíª Donate to Sentinel News Fund ‚ùìüßîüèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è‚ùìRead Asking Eric Sponsored by Things To Do Restaurants, Food & Drink Forward/Slash Distillery‚Äôs Kentucky Derby julep: A peach of a local libation Their limited-edition sip is soaked with 70 pounds of peaches from Southern Hill Farms Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X Co-owners Tim Bradstreet and Michael Buffa at Forward Slash Distillery & Blending House in Winter Park. (Willie J. Allen Jr./Orlando Sentinel) By Amy Drew Thompson | amthompson@orlandosentinel.com | Orlando Sentinel UPDATED: May 1, 2024 at 12:29 PM EDT One year ago, Forward/Slash Distillery & Blending House had barely been open a month but co-founders Tim Bradstreet and Michael Buffa, blenders of American whiskey, wanted to acknowledge this signature spirit‚Äôs signature sporting event. But they didn‚Äôt have much time to slap together a soir√©e. Throwing out a few announcements on social media, letting folks know that they should dress for the occasion, they didn‚Äôt expect a huge turnout, but customers came in droves to sip and sample in their race-day finery, which inspired the pair to plan a redux for 2024. Tart it up for Kentucky Derby day with this mini-Hot Brown appetizer And these papas got a brand new barrel. Seventy pounds of Southern Hill Farms peaches went into the mix for this peachy potable, and the pair will be parsing it out in beautifully mixed peach juleps over ‚Äúice crushed to order by the hammer of Thor,‚Äù says Buffa. Staffers here headed to the Clermont farm to procure the fruit, which was in full swing during the peach season (a tiny window here in Florida). ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs an insane ratio of peach to bourbon,‚Äù says Bradstreet. ‚ÄúSuper sweet, so we back off on the amount of sugar that goes into the julep.‚Äù A Peach Julep, the featured cocktail for the Kentucky Derby party at Forward Slash Distillery. (Willie J. Allen, Jr./Orlando Sentinel) Like the season itself, this bourbon is a limited edition, so you‚Äôll want to hit Forward/Slash (650 S. Capen Ave. in Winter Park) on Derby Day (May 4) to sample. If the barrel lasts longer, it might be a day or two. But fear not, for these Winter Park whiskey makers have a stash you‚Äôll want to sample regardless. Buffa and Bradstreet met several years back through the Orlando Whiskey Society , which Buffa founded in 2015 with a devotion that‚Äôs skin-deep. (Literally, art from his favorite distillery, Compass Box, is tattooed on his arm.) At the time, he was riding a wave of success with Buffa Bitters, working with Manifest Distillery up in Jacksonville. The product was doing well, but Buffa was tired of the round trip, hoping to do something closer to home. Co-owner and Whiskey Maker, Tim Bradstreet checks the barrels filled with their specialty whiskeys at Forward Slash Distillery in Winter Park. (Willie J. Allen, Jr./Orlando Sentinel) Bradstreet, meanwhile, was riding his own wave of success as the beverage director of the World Center Marriott. It was a wave that never crashed, though. Long hours were arduous, in particular as the birth of his first child approached. He, too, was looking for a new gig and like magic, a position with pristine demands materialized at the Gaylord Palms. Bradstreet was home by 6 p.m. every night. It was 2019, though. Like the rest of us, Bradstreet was blissfully unaware of the meteor that was about to hit. The gig lasted five months before COVID-19 crashed the party. It was a blessing and a curse, for with far less to do, the pair ‚Äî whose friendship had grown into one of burgeoning business partners ‚Äî had time to dig deeper into their distillery dreams. The Forward/Slash bar room. (Willie J. Allen Jr./Orlando Sentinel) ‚ÄúWe saw a big gap in the whiskey market,‚Äù Bradstreet explains. ‚ÄúThere was this huge influx of product, but consumers don‚Äôt really know what anything is. And what we saw was that 70 percent of these brands were coming from four giant distilleries.‚Äù It‚Äôs not a secret, they tell me, but it‚Äôs not largely talked about. ‚ÄúThese big names are buying from behemoth distilleries and spending millions in branding, but it‚Äôs not their whiskey.‚Äù In fact, some of it is the exact same whiskey , sold with different labels and at different price points. ‚ÄúAnd there was no love for the smaller guys,‚Äù Buffa notes. ‚ÄúYou had to really hustle if you were a small, independent distillery, especially here in Florida, which is the second largest whiskey market in the U.S.‚Äù Compass Box, Bradstreet explains, is completely transparent, focusing on different regions of Scotland and creating unique blends by bringing them together. ‚ÄúWhat if we did that with American distilleries?‚Äù they wondered. And so they did. Barrels filled with liquors are used to produce the unique blend of offerings at Forward Slash Distillery & Blending House in Winter Park, Fla.. (Willie J. Allen Jr./Orlando Sentinel) Forward/Slash works with small, independent distilleries and farmers. They choose carefully. They blend meticulously. They keep nerd-level notes. And they let all their fellow nerds in on the process. ‚ÄúWe tell our customers everything,‚Äù says Bradstreet. ‚ÄúThe distillers, the coopers, the mash bills, everything . Complete data dump.‚Äù Visitors to Forward/Slash can see the percentages of each whiskey in the blend. They can go even deeper and taste each element by itself if they want. It‚Äôs a theme park for nano-level enjoyment. But it‚Äôs also a killer bar with great cocktails. Because most people don‚Äôt really care. They chuckle at the observation‚Äôs accuracy. ‚ÄúMost of our customers just want a good quality beverage served to them with a smile,‚Äù says Buffa. ‚ÄúBut the niche customers love [the details]. It‚Äôs mind-blowing.‚Äù Co-owner and whiskey maker Tim Bradstreet prepares a Peach Julep, the featured cocktail for Saturday's Kentucky Derby party at Forward/Slash Distillery & Blending House in Winter Park. (Willie J. Allen Jr./Orlando Sentinel) Forward/Slash doesn‚Äôt make the whiskey they bottle and serve. They blend it. But they do distill bitters and liqueurs utilizing Florida agriculture at their Winter Park venue, which, depending on the day, is both cozy and expansive. A warm little bar up front speaks to high-level sampling in chill confines. For events, they open up the back, where another bar shares space with the still and barrels. A bar-adjacent Blending Lab is where much of the magic happens ‚Äî and where parties of 2-10 can book private tastings that feature a welcome cocktail and a 90-minute experience that includes a complete tour, an in-depth discussion of the process and a curated flight of Forward/Slash spirits. It starts at $75, and since these guys are chefs of the barrel (and you can hit Michelin-starred Soseki with a rock from here), I feel fine calling it the cheapest omakase in Winter Park. Start with the Derby, though. Methinks some of you will be sparked with a desire for deeper dabbling. Find me on Facebook, TikTok, Twitter or Instagram @amydroo or on the OSFoodie Instagram account @orlando.foodie . Email: amthompson@orlandosentinel.com , For more foodie fun, join the Let‚Äôs Eat, Orlando Facebook group . The signature margarita for Sunday's Cinco de Mayo celebration at Forward/Slash Distillery & Blending House in Winter Park. (Willie J. Allen Jr./Orlando Sentinel) Sunday Cinco Celebration Derby Day should give newcomers a festive peek at the process, too, but if you can‚Äôt make it Saturday, you may want to stop in on Sunday for a Cinco de Mayo event that will feature the launch of Sin Nombre. This wild, new blended agave spirit (it smelled like pears from the barrel) will be featured in a funky crafted margarita with a consomm√© dusted rim courtesy of the Fui Yo Mexicana food truck, whose birria was dehydrated to make the stuff. ‚ÄúThe whole building will be open, we‚Äôll have a Volkswagen Beetle set up for photo-ops ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs going to be a massive party. We‚Äôre definitely taking Monday off.‚Äù Originally Published: May 1, 2024 at 8:19 AM EDT Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Facebook Click to share on Bluesky (Opens in new window) Bluesky Click to share on X (Opens in new window) X RevContent Feed Most Popular Most Popular Universal nabs 5 Golden Tickets: 4 for Epic, 1 for Volcano Bay Universal nabs 5 Golden Tickets: 4 for Epic, 1 for Volcano Bay Can Orlando‚Äôs baseball dream survive after its biggest investors drop out? Restaurants Winter Park Distillery & Blending House Slated to Open on April 1 FORWARD/SLASH will open as a first of its kind boutique distillery & blending house Published Date: March 21, 2023, 6:11 AM EDT Written By Lisa Hay News Writer Share SHARE Central Florida‚Äôs new distillery and blending house, FORWARD/SLASH will open to the public on Saturday, April 1, The commercial warehouse located at 650 S Capen Ave Winter Park, FL 32789 has been transformed from its historic 1950‚Äôs Holler building into an expansive distillery featuring spirits from across the country, hand-selected and blended in house. Incepted by ownership team, Tim Bradstreet of former downtown Orlando restaurant, Rusty Spoon, and Beverage Director for Marriott International, alongside Michael Buffa who founded both the Orlando Whiskey Society and Buffa Bittering Company, FORWARD/SLASH will offer an elevated distilled spirits experience. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre selecting aged American Whiskeys from all across the country from independent farmers and distillers and blending these incredible barrels here at our facility to create a truly unique product. We‚Äôre 100% transparent in who and where we source our whiskeys and other spirits from, giving the customer as much information as possible while simultaneously telling the story of the people who made the distillate. We tell their story through the art of blending. And blending is an artform, it is not easy, especially when it comes to working with different mash bills from different distilleries. You have to find that perfect balance and nuance in the blend so that each part can be highlighted and bring character to the final product. Like a musician playing an instrument in an orchestra.‚Äù said Bradstreet in a statement. The concept of blending might not be new but Buffa and Bradstreet aim to offer transparency through authenticity with each of their blends. Unlike many mass-marketed spirits, their labels will showcase a comprehensive ingredient list, aiming to tell the story of the distilleries and farmers behind them. In addition to blending, they will also be distilling artisan liqueurs and bitters utilizing Florida agriculture, highlighting the bountiful offerings from local farmers. Their beverage program will roll out at open with a menu of intentionally crafted cocktails. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre picking the best ingredients possible to make the best quality cocktails so we can create an experience for people ‚Äì When you leave here, we want you to have an authentic cocktail bar experience and know what‚Äôs in your bottle. The products we are producing here are so delicious and so unique, we‚Äôre really excited to share them with everyone. ‚Äù said Buffa. With the passing of recent Florida legislation in 2021, distilleries like FORWARD/SLASH can now sell spirits for direct consumption as a tasting or in a cocktail in their tasting rooms. FORWARD/SLASH will open its doors at 4 p.m. on Saturday, April 1 and the celebration will continue through their normal operating hours of 11 p.m. Regular bar and tasting lounge hours will be Wednesday & Thursday from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. and Friday and Saturday from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. After opening, private tasting classes will begin as a means to offer a specialty guided experience into the world of distillation. 650 S Capen Ave, Winter Park, FL 32789 Be the First to Know From new restaurant openings to exciting retail launches and real estate insights, be the first to know what‚Äôs happening in Orlando Subscribe & Stay Ahead Share This Article Facebook Copy Link Print By Lisa Hay Follow: Lisa is a staff reporter for What Now Media Group. She covers new restaurant, retail, and real estate openings across all of our markets. A true foodie, this Air Force veteran has lived all over the world ‚Äî from Aviano, Italy to Nairobi, Kenya ‚Äî but her favorite spot is NOLA for its rich history, architecture, culture, and of course, its good eats. How Forward/Slash is Building Business with Thoughtful Blending ¬∑ the32789 September 10, 2025 Search the32789 News Business Food & Drink Community Arts Homes Health & Wellness Follow Us Sponsored By: Winter Park, FL News Business Food & Drink Community Arts Homes Health & Wellness Search the32789 Bartender Abel Caraballo pours a Southern Old Fashioned at the craft cocktail bar at Forward/Slash distillery and blending house. The business combines production and education to offer a unique experience for whiskey lovers. Photos by: Jim Carchidi Sponsored By: How Forward/Slash is Building Business with Thoughtful Blending By Jim Carchidi | April 3, 2023 Bartender Abel Caraballo pours a Southern Old Fashioned at the craft cocktail bar at Forward/Slash distillery and blending house. The business combines production and education to offer a unique experience for whiskey lovers. Photos by: Jim Carchidi Share This: Forward/Slash Premium Blended Whiskey celebrated the grand opening of its Winter Park distillery and blending house, located at 650 S. Capen Ave., on April 1 with a menu of craft cocktails and a peek at production. The bourbon brand is the result of a process that co-owners Tim Bradstreet and Michael Buffa are happy to discuss. ‚ÄúWe work with quality distilleries from across the country that are independently owned,‚Äù Bradstreet told the32789. ‚ÄúWe bring their product here to begin the process of blending distillates based on their flavor characteristics to create our own product.‚Äù Forward/Slash is the result of an experiential blending that began with a friendship. Bradstreet, a former beverage operations manager for Orlando World Center Marriott and Gaylord Palms, met Buffa, founder of Buffa Bittering Company , through a mutual involvement in the Orlando Whiskey Society . Forward/Slash Premium Blended Whiskey is created and served at its 650 S. Capen Ave. building. Co-owners Michael Buffa and Tim Bradstreet offer guests a peek at the blending process (above), and conversations about production will be part of the daily routine in the tasting room (below). ‚ÄúI was manufacturing out of Jacksonville, but I knew I needed to have something that was based locally,‚Äù Buffa told the32789. ‚ÄúI was considering what I thought would be unique; come to find out that Tim had the same idea and we said, ‚Äòwhy don‚Äôt we just partner up and do this?'‚Äù Their mutual industry connections gave them access to the independent distilling community; however, their opus did not reach its full potential until the 2021 passing of the Florida Craft Distilleries Law , which allows distillers to sell their products for in-house and off-site consumption. ‚ÄúWhen we started this company, we weren‚Äôt allowed to sell cocktails or pours of anything that we had distilled or blended,‚Äù said Bradstreet. ‚ÄúThe new law immediately shifted our focus.‚Äù The Forward/Slash building dates back to 1958 and sat vacant for years before the renovation. An ongoing search for a location to blend and store required the infusion of a public space to serve their product. The 7,400 square-foot 1950‚Äôs era warehouse, formerly owned by the Holler family, was renovated into a blending lab and tasting room with ample space for storage and production that includes bitters distillation. Products are served as part of the craft cocktail menu with bottled bourbon sales also available. The tasting room offers seating for 20 with roughly the same accommodation on a covered patio. Special tastings and a demonstration of the blending process will be part of scheduled tours. Tour guests will also sample the aromas of whiskies in storage, which can require up to eight months to fully mature. The blending lab is opposite the bar area and will be part of scheduled tours. Special tastings, included with the tours, will be part of a classroom-style demonstration of the blending process. The lab stocks equally-sized samples of blending subjects that will be up-sized when a suitable combination is found. Forward/Slash also offers the first blended vodka, featuring potato and sugar based distillates, and plans to add rye and single malt whiskies to its brand later in the year. Real Good cocktail whiskey is among the Forward/Slash products used at the on-site cocktail bar. Bartender Samir Patel pours an espresso martini, which is made with the company‚Äôs blended vodka. The building also offers room for expansion. Plans to double the size of the customer space with a lounge and second bar are under consideration, but Bradstreet and Buffa are currently more focused on welcoming the public, building their clientele, and producing their product. ‚ÄúEvery business starts with an idea, but I think the most successful businesses let that grow organically,‚Äù said Buffa. ‚ÄúInstead of trying to dictate what you want your customers to like, you need time to figure out who your customer base is and be able to tailor your products to them.‚Äù The tasting room is open Wednesdays and Thursdays from 4-10 p.m., and Fridays and Saturdays from 4-11 p.m. Weekday tours with private tasting classes will begin within a month, information will be posted on the Forward/Slash website . Share This: Have a story idea?  Send us a note at news@the32789.com .  Follow our stories on Instagram , Twitter , and Facebook . About the Author This story was written by Jim Carchidi, one of our collection of writers covering news in Winter Park, Florida. Our staff writers can be reached at news@the32789.com. Contact Us
‚Äì Fernie Distillers ${{amount}} Skip to content 0 Shop Now Cocktail Menu Gallery Tours About Us Our Story History Learn More Community Spirit Tastings Media Retailers Events Book your Event with us Events at the Distillery Cart ( 0 ) Home Limited Edition Year-round Spirits Tours Cocktail Menu About Us Wholesale Shop Now Gallery Contact tastingroom@ferniedistillers.com Facebook Instagram Age verification By clicking enter you are verifying that you are old enough to consume alcohol. Enter Our Story There are times in life when big decisions are made.¬†Husband and wife team of Andrew Hayden and Jillian Rutherford took the plunge and established Fernie Distillers in 2016. Who We Are 1 2 Jillian, with her engineering background, is one of the few female distillers in Canada and is central to the operation. Combined with Andrew's experience working with global beverage alcohol brands and consumer packaged goods, they make a well-blended management team with all the necessary industry experience. The business draws inspiration from the community and its spirit and this extends to working relationships with other organizations, businesses and individuals in Fernie.¬†Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference. Rich in History 1 2 We have a close relationship with our neighbours at Branch 36 of the Royal Canadian Legion. We are right next door. Sitting around the table with our friends at the Legion meat draw (every Saturday at 4pm), it was suggested that the hall become the home of the distillery. The rest is history . Found on 1st Ave, adjacent to Station Square in the heart of downtown Fernie, BC.¬†Fernie Distillers lies in the centre of a resilient community that has survived numerous disasters only to recover and prosper. Fernie Distillers faces the railroad track where the original pioneering prospectors and miners disembarked ready to begin their new lives. Close your eyes and take a sip of one of our hand-crafted spirits, listen for the whistle of the train on the tracks and transport yourself back to those bygone days in our lounge. We have designed our space with you in mind. It has been renovated to be a welcoming and comfortable space unlike any other space in Fernie. Informal and yet refined at the same time, it is versatile and is available as a private event venue. Click here to inquire .¬† View the stills, chat with the distiller and learn about the process. Have a tasting of our current products. Relax in the lounge and enjoy a cocktail.¬† Our retail area has bottled spirits for sale as well as apparel and a selection of other unique items. Join the Distillers Roundtable Get the inside scoop from the team at Fernie Distillers. Email Subscribe *** FALL HOURS ***

View All Articles Life In Orlando Theme Parks Real Estate About Us Our Story Careers Menu Close Forward/Slash Distillery and Blending House By Yasmene Warren Drinking whiskey is fun, but doing so in a place that specializes in it is even more fun. Luckily, there‚Äôs just the place in Winter Park for you to experience that fun feeling on your own, and it‚Äôs called Forward/Slash. Image by Forward/Slash Distillery What is Forward/Slash? Forward/Slash is a bar that is both a distillery and blending house located in Winter Park on South Capen Avenue, and it specializes in crafting premium blended whiskeys. This place aims to tilt the whiskey industry forward through its passion in creating what the owners describe as ‚Äúinteresting whiskeys.‚Äù What sets American Blended Whiskey apart from traditional whiskey, according to Forward/Slash‚Äôs website, is that the former only needs to have some whiskey blended into the bottle for it to be considered blended whiskey and that the majority of it can be neutral spirit or vodka. This means, a bottle of blended whiskey could be 80% vodka. This is what sets Forward/Slash apart from other blended whiskey makers as the creators think that that‚Äôs wrong. This place only blends barrel-aged American Whiskey from only ‚Äúthe most passionate and talented distillers in the country.‚Äù You can see the blending in action and catch a drink or two from Forward/Slash Wednesdays and Thursdays from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. and Fridays and Saturdays from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. Image by Forward/Slash Distillery The Ambiance Pulling up to the Forward/Slash distillery, you‚Äôre met with a black garage door and a full view of where the blending happens. As you make your way into the entrance, you‚Äôll walk through a cozy outdoor seating area and into the bar where the lights are dim and warm, and the decor screams ‚Äúclassy!‚Äù Greenery sits atop the very high-up window sill, and the walls are lined with wooden decor. Have a seat at the bar and learn how the masters themselves make magic happen with the drinks they serve! What to Do and Drink Because Forward/Slash is more than just any old bar, there‚Äôs a bit more to do here. Its tasting room hours are the same as its hours of operation, and you can drop in for a tasting experience or even have this place host an event for you. Image by Forward/Slash Distillery You can also book a private whiskey tasting online with Forward/Slash and receive a tasting room tour, see in-depth the whiskey blending process, sample some products and do so with the company co-founders themselves for 90 minutes! Right now, you can order half and full ounce pours of bourbon such as singular selections like MB Roland and Filibuster, as well as singular reserves like Journeyman, Breuckelen and Manifest. You can also order a bourbon flight, a rye flight or a single malt flight. As for the full-service cocktail bar, the menu is constantly changing and having new, unique creations added to it. You can order the ‚Äú1st Drink on the Menu‚Äù ‚Äî yes, that‚Äôs literally what it‚Äôs called ‚Äî which is a vodka soda with a Florida citrus blend. There‚Äôs also the Gothic Revival, which has bourbon, acid corrected blood orange, strawberry, cinnamon, balsamic and mint. Forward/Slash also serves a variety of other cocktails like a traditional old fashioned, a gin and tonic, and an espresso martini. There are plenty of other options, and they‚Äôre always changing, so stop in and try them for yourself! Overall This isn‚Äôt just some ordinary bar as it has a lot more to offer. Whether you‚Äôre booking a tour, having a blended whiskey tasting, or simply just in the mood for a good drink, Forward/Slash will leave you satisfied! Winter Park Winter Park is a booming city in Orange County located just minutes outside of greater Orlando . It‚Äôs filled with rich history, art, small businesses and a whole lot of local restaurants and bars. Whether you‚Äôre taking a walk downtown or heading to the farmers market, there‚Äôs always something to do here. Looking for homes in the area? The Orlando Real is sponsored by The Pozek Group. If you‚Äôre thinking of buying or selling a home in Orlando, reach out and we would love to help! Search Orlando Real Estate Listings Bedrooms Bathrooms Price Range Refine

By doing so we reduce our carbon footprint and at the same time we can collect only the best ingredients to make great tasting spirits. The spent grains are recycled to produce gas for the local community and our used botanicals are composted for use in local community planting schemes.
